Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Poor Service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelsby3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a visit to the Johns Hopkins Homewood Campus. This property was listed as near the campus, it is not. About a 15 minute drive. The rate was good, setting is lovely and grounds are beautiful, the rooms were fine too. The front desk service is poor. We only had 2 towels in our room for 3 people, when I asked for more, I was told that they did not know where the clean towels were. I called again and was told that I could come down to get them. Also, there was no dinner available at the property and the suggestions listed were either closed or permanently gone. We went back to the front desk to ask for help and they could not tell us where to eat???? We ended up using our GPS and found a great place, Donna's. Would choose a hotel closer to campus next time.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, Quiet, & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Mere312
Reviews.Content: I needed a place to stay while doing a first round of hunting on my own. I chose the Mt. Washington Conference Center because of its affiliation with Hopkins (my husband is new faculty), the quiet area, and its amenities (free parking, free wi-fi, free continental breakfast). While only a touch on the "no frills" side (the furniture and bathroom are little institutional), it's a great value, clean, and convenient. Nice balcony/patio. Very close to 83 and Falls Rd. Nice breakfast (plus sodas and a selection of Tazo teas, granola bars, etc.). No restaurant or bar, but it's not a bad drive to anything in Baltimore or Towson. My bed was very comfortable and the linens are nice. Very close to a Whole Foods and Starbucks. I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: goneinaheartbeat
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Johns Hopkins University and stayed here as they had a shuttle and we wouldnt have to drive. when we checked in, we found out the shuttle didnt run on weekends. The room was nice. maybe a little small. Thin walls in bathroom (could hear people in other bathroom). My daughter felt the bed and pillows were uncomfortable but i thought they were fine. Good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: Lydia E
Reviews.Content: Poor reviews had made me nervous to book this location for our event. However, from the beginning of my communication with the Hotel Manager, I found the staff to be overwhelmingly nice and helpful. They went out of their way to be sure we had everything we needed for our overnight event. We booked the queen bedrooms and suites, and everyone commented on how beautiful the rooms were. The grounds are a beautiful, tranquil scene to take in, between meetings. The food was commented on as "ridiculously good!" From the time our patrons arrived, they were asked by all hotel staff if they needed anything, and to let them know if they could serve them in any way. The price we paid for the services we received was incredible! I couldn't come close to the final price at any other area hotels, and I highly recommend you consider this hotel for your event. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome conference center, just okay hotel...”
Reviews.Author: annanas28
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference so this is for both the hotel and conference center. I'd give the conference center 4 stars and the hotel 2 stars, so it averages out to 3 and you can read whichever is more relevant to your needs :) I think it's a really nice conference center. The area is really beautiful, the facilities themselves (i.e. the conference rooms) are clean and well-appointed, the staff was great, and the food was excellent. I loved that they kept us well-supplied with delicious meals, snacks, drinks and caffeine throughout! The hotel left something to be desired. The staff was really nice and friendly and the rooms are clean, but they are very dorm-like in a lot of ways. Definitely good enough for staying at the conference though since I had no free time! :) Overall had a nice stay here and would recommend it, especially for a conference or meeting.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: travelizzy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel part of the conference center for two nights in October of 2011. The room decor reminded me of a college dorm with built in desks and shelves. The facility is definitely well-used, however, it was clean, safe, and quiet, which is what I needed. The location is about a 15 minute drive from downtown Baltimore, but is walkable from the light rail if you don't have a car. For food you can easily walk to the Mount Washington neighborhood, where there are restaurants and a grocery store. There was a breakfast in the morning, but I left too early both days to see what that entailed. I would recommend to anyone who needs a no-frills, economical, but yet still safe stay in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the best place for hosting a large group!”
Reviews.Author: luckyjas
Reviews.Content: This conference center is accessible, economical and the service was superb. The food was plentiful and the choices were vast. The beds and sheets were very nice and each room has a balcony. The grounds are beautiful and in a great area. Close to light rail and restaurants. Great gym and the snack stations throughout the property are always stocked and open 24 hours! The conference center has free-wifi throughout and in every room and a business center that doesn't charge for copies and computer time!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but noisy”
Reviews.Author: isismoon69
Reviews.Content: Lovely facility but the staff was quite noisy during our business meeting, it was very distracting. At one point the staff started removing items from our room ... maybe in preparation for the next meeting?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay. Pleasant and clean.”
Reviews.Author: Scamp2011
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was simple but good. The property is nice. They have a game room with a pool table and ping pong table for those rainy nights like we had which was nice to have on that night. The beds were a little on the firm side, but not like a rock. The front deck personel were very nice and helpful. The light rail into downtown Baltimore was very easy. The gym was nice, but was told you needed to be 18 to go upstairs into the basketball part of the gym. In the same building as the gym is a cafeteria which has good for for a good price. As for the review before mine. You can go the any upscale hotel and if the people in the next room come back to their room late and are load you'll here it. It's not the hotels fault, it's simply the load people in the next room. Would recommend for the average person or family, but not the people that expect the Ritz Carlton!

Reviews.Title: “great location but very disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: jhu81alum
Reviews.Content: The Mt Washington Conference Center has a beautiful location on a lush hill, and very close to Rt 83, but the attention to fundamentals was lacking. We stayed for 2 nights and when we checked in immediately noticed the toilet was running-- how could they miss that noise?! There was a coffee machine in the room with no coffee-- what's up with that?!! We pointed out these things the next morning to housekeeping and left for the day. When we came back- Toilet still running and no coffee!! To make matters worse, they didnt provide a change of towels, or give us fresh (plastic) cups. Very sloppy. Room was a bit cramped and loud clanging noises in the middle of the night (both nights). On the plus side you get privileges at a nice fitness room one building away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Nenepox
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Mt. Washington Conference center and stayed in the rooms. This is a great place for a M-F conference when you want to focus on the conference. Mt. Washington Village is a short walk down hill and the light rale is also. But there are no child oriented activities on site other than a pool table and ping pong. The staff was fabulous - super accomodating to me as well as my family. The rooms are small but clean and have a little deck. Housekeeping stopped me in the hall twice to ask if my room was acceptable. Everyone was super friendly!! I would com back for a conference or short get away!!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: chic0junit
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible for the price. If you are looking for a Baltimore hotel that is great value then this one is the right choice. The hotel was a short drive from the center of Baltimore, steps away from the light rail if you don't feel like driving, and right near the highway. It's in a quiet area just outside of Baltimore city. The staff was extremely friendly, the rooms were great but nothing fancy. Continental breakfast in the morning was adequate. Location was great. Perfect hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A HOTEL, this is a dorm room”
Reviews.Author: logicalmouse
Reviews.Content: I feel very cheated, we saw the picture on the website, and it looks nothing like that. Lets be clear, this is NOT a hotel, it does not have any of the amenities of a hotel whatsoever unless you could a bed and a bathroom (which I think would also be a jail). This is nothing more than a 1970's style dorm room, there are placards that say "no alcoholic beverages", what if I wanted a glass of wine with dinner? This is ridiculous to treat this as you would a hotel, it is apples and oranges, and is IN NO WAY 3.5 stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Short Light Rail Ride to the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Hjk131
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night in June. The hotel is with in walking distance to the light rail, which we took to the inner harbor. It was very convenient to get to the Inner Harbor, and even easier to get back to the hotel after attending a baseball game. We were able to see numerous attractions during the day. The hotel staff were very friendly. I will definitely stay here again when my baseball team is in town!

Reviews.Title: “Very Quiet and Great Quality for the Price”
Reviews.Author: DolphinsFan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the conference center for one night while traveling on business. I did not want to stay in downtown Baltimore as a single female traveling alone. I will stay here again. I was in room 312 and it was great. Good size, comfortable chair and comfortable bed. I also liked having a private balcony. The staff were very friendly. Parking was easy and enjoyed the quiet atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant location but not much service”
Reviews.Author: MartinAB
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel while visiting Johns Hopkins University. The positives of the hotel are : 1) attractive and serene setting on a satellite campus of the University, 2) comfort basic room, 3) easy parking, and 4) adequate continental breakfast. The location is a hard to find if you arrive in the dark as it some distance off the main road and the only sign is on an unlit listing of the many campus buildings. When I called the hotel at 9PM to ask for assistance in finding the hotel I was greeted by a recording inviting me to leave a message. Upon arriving at the hotel the front desk was deserted and we had to ask around to get assistance. In general this facility gives the feel of an casual academic conference center more than a service oriented three star hotel. The main campus of Johns Hopkins is about a 15 minute drive from this facility. Finally, we were glad that we had stopped at the Baltimore Harbor area for dinner before arriving at the hotel as we didn't notice a single open restaurant once we got off the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Much More Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Prodance
Reviews.Content: Visiting Johns Hopkins with Teenager and did not want to pay the unbelievable through the roof prices of most of the Baltimore lodging, so I took a chance on Mt Washington Conference Center. This is actually owned by Johns Hopkins University. I have learned to read through the lines on tripadvisor reviews and have learned which ones to ignore. I will certainly be staying here again. First of all I do agree that although very clean, the rooms are a cross between a large dorm or a hospital room. But so what. The beds were as new and comfortable as in any top hotel. Everything worked and everything needed was supplied. The bathroom had "green" natural soaps and shampoos and I actually found them much softer on the skin and hair than some of those top products in 5 star hotels. Each room has a small balcony with chairs and it was nice to sit out there and read in the sun. Breakfast was a cold buffet that included bagels, cereals, pastries, yogurts, juices, hardboiled eggs, coffee, tea, bottled waters, sodas. Certainly enough to make an adequate breakfast. The attendant was so nice that even though it was past the time for breakfast and she was trying to clean up, she kept responding to requests for more items for a good extra hour. Also the front desk staff was very helpful, polite and responsive at all times. There is a very large work out room that you have access to. It is similiar to what you would have in a small health club. There is also a very nice lounge area with a pool table and large TV. I spent time walking around inside the buldings. It is so large that I was lost but I found so many beautiful areas, marble staircases, outside dining decks, fountains, meeting rooms, cafeterias, etc. Also the grounds are wooded with paths to walk. I peeked inside the business center which was the largest I have seen, although I did not use it. Parking is free. How can you go wrong here?

Reviews.Title: “Shabby with near non-existent service”
Reviews.Author: FWIW_NYC
Reviews.Content: • Room about the size of a dorm • Front desk did not pick up the phone after 9pm despite repeated tries on my part. • Hair in the bathtub. • Dirt and scuffs on wall. • Shampoo bottle had already been used -- cap was even ajar. • No dining options.

Reviews.Title: “A leafy escape”
Reviews.Author: tucsonanne
Reviews.Content: If you want easy access to baltimore's downtown (train in Mt. Washington Village or short hop down the Jones Falls Expy) and do not want noisy crowds, this is the place for you. It's a conference center that rents rooms, which means no food is served, but it's a short walk to Mt. Washington Village, and there's pizza delivery. The room was fine; the beds were great; there is a small terrace outside each room; and the price is amazing for the quality. After a day of sightseeing, what better respite than to be surrounded by acres of beautiful grounds?

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: JRLCW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this conference center for a Hopkins-associated meeting. The location is a bit far from the airport and downtown area, but the grounds and Mt. Washington town area are nice to wander around. Because I was booked here for a meeting with a group of people, our stay included all meals and snacks. This made for a convenient, although somewhat less-than-exciting stay. The guestrooms in the conference center were adequate and reasonably clean, though lacking in character. The complimentary business center and gym access were a nice touch. The Octagon Building has an interesting history, serving as a finishing school for girls and later a college.

HotelInfo.Name: Mt. Washington Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 5801 Smith Avenue Suite 1100, Baltimore, MD 21209
